2168.verse: وَٱصْبِرْ|And be patient,|123|132|8353$نَفْسَكَ|yourself,|77|94|4253$مَعَ|with|48|65|443$ٱلَّذِينَ|those who|89|106|20$يَدْعُونَ|call|87|104|1942$رَبَّهُم|their Lord|83|100|3649$بِٱلْغَدَوٲةِ|in the morning|114|123|5622$وَٱلْعَشِىِّ|and the evening|127|139|5623$يُرِيدُونَ|desiring|94|118|4112$وَجْهَهُۥ‌ۖ|His Face|91|115|1043$وَلَا|And (let) not|106|130|25$تَعْدُ|pass beyond|103|127|10719$عَيْنَاكَ|your eyes|85|97|10720$عَنْهُمْ|over them,|92|100|2643$تُرِيدُ|desiring|70|86|10721$زِينَةَ|adornment|90|106|6360$ٱلْحَيَوٲةِ|(of) the life|96|112|817$ٱلدُّنْيَا‌ۖ|(of) the world,|117|133|818$وَلَا|and (do) not|104|120|25$تُطِعْ|obey|61|69|5972$مَنْ|whom|58|69|76$أَغْفَلْنَا|We Have Made Heedless|182|204|10722$قَلْبَهُۥ|his heart|78|100|10723$عَن|of|54|76|1105$ذِكْرِنَا|Our rememberance,|149|171|10724$وَٱتَّبَعَ|and follows|94|105|4492$هَوَٮٰهُ|his desires|89|145|7004$وَكَانَ|and is|71|183|363$أَمْرُهُۥ|his affair|80|192|10725$فُرُطًا|(in) excess.|98|154|10726$

2169.verse: وَقُلِ|And say,|78|88|7888$ٱلْحَقُّ|"The truth|88|109|268$مِن|(is) from|76|97|53$رَّبِّكُمْ‌ۖ|your Lord,|87|108|490$فَمَن|so whoever|96|117|402$شَآءَ|wills -|59|80|2277$فَلْيُؤْمِن|let him believe|115|126|10727$وَمَن|and whoever|105|111|1012$شَآءَ|wills -|59|71|2277$فَلْيَكْفُرْ‌ۚ|let him disbelieve."|143|155|10728$إِنَّآ|Indeed, We|96|108|120$أَعْتَدْنَا|have prepared|115|127|3827$لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ|for the wrongdoers|146|152|2438$نَارًا|a Fire,|62|83|140$أَحَاطَ|will surround|102|144|10422$بِهِمْ|them|53|95|125$سُرَادِقُهَا‌ۚ|its walls.|100|142|10729$وَإِن|And if|58|100|213$يَسْتَغِيثُواْ|they call for relief,|142|163|10730$يُغَاثُواْ|they will be relieved|152|170|10731$بِمَآءٍ|with water|91|127|10732$كَٱلْمُهْلِ|like molten brass,|135|171|10733$يَشْوِى|(which) scalds|116|152|10734$ٱلْوُجُوهَ‌ۚ|the faces.|88|106|10735$بِئْسَ|Wretched|84|121|8726$ٱلشَّرَابُ|(is) the drink,|110|184|10736$وَسَآءَتْ|and evil|94|168|4366$مُرْتَفَقًا|(is) the resting place.|164|201|10737$

2170.verse: إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|87|58$ٱلَّذِينَ|those who|89|123|20$ءَامَنُواْ|believed|82|116|84$وَعَمِلُواْ|and did|92|126|238$ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ|the good deeds,|128|162|239$إِنَّا|indeed, We|94|111|120$لَا نُضِيعُ|will not let go waste|155|174|10738$أَجْرَ|(the) reward|104|142|3506$مَنْ|(of one) who|106|144|76$أَحْسَنَ|does good|88|126|6192$عَمَلاً|deeds.|69|88|7875$

2171.verse: أُوْلَـٰٓئِكَ|Those,|82|92|51$لَهُمْ|for them|76|96|98$جَنَّـٰتُ|(are) Gardens|111|130|9435$عَدْنٍ|of Eden,|75|94|7746$تَجْرِى|flows|81|100|242$مِن|from|50|70|53$تَحْتِهِمُ|underneath them|133|143|6399$ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ|the rivers.|88|98|244$يُحَلَّوْنَ|They will be adorned|157|178|10739$فِيهَا|therein|66|87|253$مِنْ|[of] (with)|90|111|53$أَسَاوِرَ|bracelets|81|102|10740$مِن|of|50|71|53$ذَهَبٍ|gold|68|78|10741$وَيَلْبَسُونَ|and will wear|106|112|10742$ثِيَابًا|garments,|86|99|10743$خُضْرًا|green,|87|100|10744$مِّن|of|50|63|53$سُندُسٍ|fine silk|82|95|10745$وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍ|and heavy brocade,|152|165|10746$مُّتَّكِــِٔينَ|reclining|86|92|10747$فِيهَا|therein|66|82|253$عَلَى|on|63|94|52$ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ‌ۚ|adorned couches.|138|169|10748$نِعْمَ|Excellent|79|110|7263$ٱلثَّوَابُ|(is) the reward,|124|155|10749$وَحَسُنَتْ|and good|99|115|10750$مُرْتَفَقًا|(is) the resting place.|164|164|10737$

2172.verse: ۞ وَٱضْرِبْ|And set forth|151|159|10751$لَهُم|to them|72|87|98$مَّثَلاً|the example|100|115|261$رَّجُلَيْنِ|of two men:|101|116|2534$جَعَلْنَا|We provided|102|117|1137$لِأَحَدِهِمَا|for one of them|123|131|10752$جَنَّتَيْنِ|two gardens|102|109|10753$مِنْ|of|50|64|53$أَعْنَـٰبٍ|grapes,|82|96|5887$وَحَفَفْنَـٰهُمَا|and We bordered them|171|185|10754$بِنَخْلٍ|with date-palms,|132|146|10755$وَجَعَلْنَا|and We placed|118|125|4805$بَيْنَهُمَا|between both of them|168|384|3978$زَرْعًا|crops.|76|292|10756$

2173.verse: كِلْتَا|Each|55|63|10757$ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ|(of) the two gardens|159|176|10758$ءَاتَتْ|brought forth|108|125|10759$أُكُلَهَا|its produce|94|111|2396$وَلَمْ|and not|71|88|2566$تَظْلِم|did wrong|84|101|10760$مِّنْهُ|of it|53|61|571$شَيْــًٔا‌ۚ|anything.|82|118|472$وَفَجَّرْنَا|And We caused to gush forth|215|286|10761$خِلَـٰلَهُمَا|within them|97|168|10762$نَهَرًا|a river.|67|103|10763$

2168.verse: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

2169.verse: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

2170.verse: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

2171.verse: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

2172.verse: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.

2173.verse: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

2174.verse: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."
